intro: Ecbolium chamaedryodes, commonly known as the rock scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in rocky and arid environments.
